item.description:
Please come to both events (Tues & Fri) if possible - WE NEED YOU to make a difference! This is the second in a proposed week long protest against Yale Vivisection for National Primate Liberation Week 2012. Let's make our presence known on behalf of animals!

Please spread the word to your animal network and join us.

Yale University imprisons, tortures & murders over 150,000 animals including primates, dogs, cats, sheep, pigs, ferrets, rodents, and others.

Yale experimenters have drilled holes into the skulls of animals, stuck needles into their brains, forced them to consume dangerous drugs including cocaine, and have subjected them to electrical shocks.

There is almost no end to the ways that animals suffer in Yale labs before being killed.


Yale considers this to be a humane and responsible use of animals and experimenters document their abuses in academic papers that boost their careers rather than bring them jail time.

Please join us in exposing these Ivy League abusers and in standing up for animals!


Leaflets and signs will be provided; but feel free to make your own signs if you prefer.

Let us know if you need transportation.

For more information please go to
http://yalelabanimals.blogspot.com/

https://www.facebook.com/groups/yale.lab.animals/

Directions From I-91 South
Take Exit 1 (Route 34 Connector, Downtown New Haven)
Follow connector to the end (traffic light)
Take a right on York Street
Next right onto George Street
300 George Street is about 0.2 miles on your right, immediately past the AT&T parking garage (the building is gray paneled with a portico over the front door)

Directions From I-95 North and South
Take Exit 47; Proceed onto the Route 34 Connector
Follow connector to the end (traffic light)
Take a right on York Street
Next right onto George Street
300 George Street is about 0.2 miles on your right, immediately past the AT&T parking garage

group.name: The New Haven Vegan Meetup Group

item.name: Protest 2 for Yale Lab Animals - National Primate Liberation Week
